{"abstract": " The Canadian aluminum producer Alcan rejected a $27.4 billion hostile bid from a rival, Alcoa, on Tuesday, calling the offer inadequate. Mr. Goodyear has overseen a wave of record-setting earnings since taking charge of the company in 2003 as the company benefited from a China-led boom in demand for iron and other metals. But in the last two years, soaring prices for copper have fueled BHP\u2019s results. {"abstract": "European Union regulators extended an investigation into BHP Billiton\u2019s hostile bid for the Rio Tinto Group because of \u201cserious doubts\u201d about the combination.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2008/07/05/business/worldbusiness/05bizbriefs-EUROPEDELAYS_BRF.html", "snippet": "European Union regulators extended an investigation into BHP Billiton\u2019s hostile bid for the Rio Tinto Group because of \u201cserious doubts\u201d about the combination.", "lead_paragraph": "European Union regulators extended an investigation into BHP Billiton\u2019s hostile bid for the Rio Tinto Group because of \u201cserious doubts\u201d about the combination, which would control more than a third of the world\u2019s iron ore production. The European Commission, in charge of antitrust rulings, will review the proposed $163 billion acquisition for an additional 90 working days and announce a decision by Nov. 11, it said in a statement in Brussels on Friday. The antitrust division of the United States Justice Department gave partial approval Thursday. The takeover also needs agreement from Australia and South Africa. {"abstract": "Employers hired almost three times as many workers in August as economists had forecast, adding to evidence that an Australian mining boom is offsetting weaker domestic demand.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2008/09/12/business/worldbusiness/12fobriefs-JOBCREATIONT_BRF.html", "snippet": "Employers hired almost three times as many workers in August as economists had forecast, adding to evidence that an Australian mining boom is offsetting weaker domestic demand.", "lead_paragraph": "Employers hired almost three times as many workers in August as economists had forecast, adding to evidence that an Australian mining boom is offsetting weaker domestic demand. The number of people employed rose 14,600 last month, the Australian Statistics Bureau said. Economists had forecast an increase of 5,000. The jobless rate fell to 4.1 percent, from 4.3 percent. The number of full-time jobs rose about 7,500 in August and part-time jobs increased roughly 7,200. The August employment gain followed a revised increase of 18,700 jobs in July. Demand for skilled labor at companies including BHP Billiton is helping generate new jobs. {"abstract": "The Chinese government\u2019s largest investment ever in a Western company, a proposed $19.5 billion stake in the Australian-British mining giant Rio Tinto Group, collapsed early Friday.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2009/06/05/turning-to-bhp-billiton-rio-tinto-scraps-china-deal/", "snippet": "The Chinese government\u2019s largest investment ever in a Western company, a proposed $19.5 billion stake in the Australian-British mining giant Rio Tinto Group, collapsed early Friday.", "lead_paragraph": "The Chinese government\u2019s largest planned investment ever in a Western company, a proposed $19.5 billion stake in the Australian-British mining giant Rio Tinto Group, collapsed early Friday, dealing a blow both to China\u2019s global corporate ambitions and to its efforts to gain clout in the natural resources market, The New York Times\u2019s David Barboza and Michael Wines reported.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Turning to BHP Billiton, Rio Tinto Scraps China Deal", "kicker": "DealBook", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [], "pub_date": "2009-06-05T05:46:31+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By Dealbook", "person": [{"firstname": "Dealbook", "middlename": null, "lastname": "", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/ace187b3-b864-57ae-8870-b6f7eb4b9865", "word_count": 1096, "uri": "nyt://article/ace187b3-b864-57ae-8870-b6f7eb4b9865"}

{"abstract": "The Wuhan Iron & Steel Group, a Chinese steelmaker, agreed to pay $400 million for a stake in Brazil\u2019s MMX Mineracao e Metalicos to broaden its supply of iron ore.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2009/12/01/business/global/01fobriefs-CHINESEBUYST_BRF.html", "snippet": "The Wuhan Iron & Steel Group, a Chinese steelmaker, agreed to pay $400 million for a stake in Brazil\u2019s MMX Mineracao e Metalicos to broaden its supply of iron ore.", "lead_paragraph": "The Wuhan Iron & Steel Group, a Chinese steelmaker, agreed to pay $400 million for a stake in Brazil\u2019s MMX Mineracao e Metalicos to broaden its supply of iron ore. Wuhan Steel, based in Hubei province, will appoint two board members to MMX and become the second-biggest shareholder of the Brazilian company with a 21.52 percent stake, the Chinese company said. MMX, which is based in Rio de Janeiro, has a market value of 3.7 billion reais ($2.1 billion), according to Bloomberg data. China, the world\u2019s biggest steel producer, is investing in iron-ore projects globally to reduce dependence on Vale, the Rio Tinto Group and BHP Billiton. Wuhan Iron and EBX, MMX\u2019s holding company, also signed an accord to build a steel plant in Brazil, said a Wuhan Steel spokesman, Bai Fang. {"abstract": "With the genie of state intervention already out of the bottle, shareholders of the Brazilian mining giant Vale should prepare for their interests to come second.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2011/04/04/business/04views.html", "snippet": "With the genie of state intervention already out of the bottle, shareholders of the Brazilian mining giant Vale should prepare for their interests to come second.", "lead_paragraph": "Last week\u2019s ouster of the chief executive of Vale, the mining giant based in Rio de Janeiro, sends a terrible signal to the markets about the Brazilian government\u2019s intentions. The executive, Roger Agnelli, resisted the state\u2019s designs to push the $180 billion company into lower-return, if labor-intensive, activities. With President Dilma Rousseff\u2019s government forcing his departure, investors must brace for a strategy that favors jobs over profit \u2014 in the fashion of Pemex instead of BHP Billiton.", "print_section": "B", "print_page": "2", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [{"rank": 0, "subtype": "jumbo", "caption": null, "credit": null, "type": "image", "url": "images/2011/04/04/business/04views/04views-jumbo.jpg", "height": 549, "width": 1024, "subType": "jumbo", "crop_name": "jumbo", "legacy": {}}], "headline": {"main": "Lesson in Being a State Company", "kicker": "Reuters Breakingviews", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "Lesson in Being A State Company", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "organizations", "value": "Federal Reserve System", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Cohn, Gary D", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Financial Crisis Inquiry Commission", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Goldman Sachs Group Inc", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Appointments and Executive Changes", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2011-04-04T02:29:52+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By Rob Cox and Agnes T. {"abstract": "BHP Billiton, the world\u2019s largest mining company, sits atop a sector that is deeply out of favor with investors, and it is aggressively curtailing its spending in hopes of winning them over.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2013/08/08/after-going-all-in-during-mining-boom-bhp-cuts-its-ambitions/", "snippet": "BHP Billiton, the world\u2019s largest mining company, sits atop a sector that is deeply out of favor with investors, and it is aggressively curtailing its spending in hopes of winning them over.", "lead_paragraph": "BHP Billiton, the world\u2019s largest mining company, was willing to spend big in early 2012. It was building new mines and upgrading old ones, at a cost of $18 billion. {"abstract": "Shares at both Canadian companies jumped after they confirmed early negotiations. A deal would put their combined equity value at around $28 billion.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2016/08/31/business/dealbook/potash-corp-and-agrium-discuss-merger-deal.html", "snippet": "Shares at both Canadian companies jumped after they confirmed early negotiations. A deal would put their combined equity value at around $28 billion.", "lead_paragraph": "A potash giant may soon emerge from the ashes of failed global matchmaking. Canadian fertilizer producers Potash Corp. and Agrium say they are discussing a merger. The potential deal follows a string of aborted industry combinations dating back to the Australian miner BHP Billiton\u2019s $39 billion attempted buyout of Potash in 2010 \u2014 in retrospect, a dodged bullet for BHP.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Potash Corp. and Agrium Discuss Merger Deal", "kicker": "Breakingviews", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan Inc", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "BHP Billiton PLC", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2016-08-30T22:19:49+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "DealBook", "byline": {"original": "By Kevin Allison", "person": [{"firstname": "Kevin", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Allison", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/0909613f-4234-5ca0-9af0-f02413732bb2", "word_count": 313, "uri": "nyt://article/0909613f-4234-5ca0-9af0-f02413732bb2"}

{"abstract": "The straightforward, no-premium deal is a contrast to other recent attempts at industry mash-ups, which did not fare so well.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2016/09/13/business/dealbook/potash-and-agrium-deal-is-a-friendly-balanced-merger.html", "snippet": "The straightforward, no-premium deal is a contrast to other recent attempts at industry mash-ups, which did not fare so well.", "lead_paragraph": "It is a rare corporate love-in. The Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan and Agrium, a fertilizer company, have agreed to a merger of equals worth $36 billion in enterprise value. Monday\u2019s straightforward, no-premium deal is a contrast to other recent attempts at industry mash-ups, which gave off a whiff of exuberance before collapsing.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Potash and Agrium Deal Is a Friendly, Balanced Merger", "kicker": "Breakingviews", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Mines and Mining", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Monsanto Company", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Bayer AG", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "BHP Billiton PLC", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "DuPont Co", "rank": 6, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2016-09-12T18:13:52+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "DealBook", "byline": {"original": "By Kevin Allison", "person": [{"firstname": "Kevin", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Allison", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/c9c364b3-3a0a-5797-8b1f-d22349db31ed", "word_count": 377, "uri": "nyt://article/c9c364b3-3a0a-5797-8b1f-d22349db31ed"}
